titles.title: Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" / Täʾamrä Mikaʾel "Miracles of Michael" / Täʾamrä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus "Miracles of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus"

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" (fols. 3ra-70rb) I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 3ra-6vb) I-2) Introductory exhortation and hymns (fols. 6vb-9rb) I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki ... "I worship Thee ..." (fols. 9va-10ra) I-4) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 71 miracles (fols. 10rb-70rb), incomplete II) Täʾamrä Mikaʾel "Miracles of Michael": 1 miracle and ʿarke-hymn (fols. 70va-71rb) III) Täʾamrä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus "Miracles of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus": 1 miracle and ʿarke-hymn (fol. 71rb-vb l.7)
Additiones 1-2.

copyists.copyist: ʿAśratä Maryam (hand a) is mentioned as the scribe in supplication formulas throughout Text I; possibly he is the scribe of DMD-007. Gäbrä Śǝllase (hand b) is mentioned as the scribe in the supplication formula on fol. 71rb (Text III).

donors.donor:
The name of Ḍäḥayä Lǝda (cp. Ms. AP-022) is written in supplication formulas throughout Text I, in hand a (fols. 7ra, 10rb, 11ra etc.). In addition, his relatives are mentioned: his wife Wälättä Muse (fols. 8rb, 11rb, 14ra etc.), his son Gäbrä Ṣadǝq (fols. 12va, 35ra etc.), his father Mäzgäbä Śǝllase (fol. 21ra, 25ra, 33ra etc.) and his mother Wälättä ʾArägawi (fols. 27rb, 33vb, 39va etc.).
The name Ḫaylä Maryam is written in Additio 1, in hand b (fol. 2r).

dcomments.dcomment: ʿAśratä Maryam also wrote Ms. GMS-010 which is datable to 1841-52.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn and was resewn. Fol. 72 is cut in half.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes and tears are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 2, 2 stub after 1/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) –II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(10/fols. 27r-36v) – V(8/fols. 37r-44v) – VI(8/fols. 45r-52v) – VII(8/fols. 53r-60v) – VIII(8/fols. 61r-68v) – IX(4/fols. 69r-72v)

taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Some fols. have additional ruled lines at the bottom (fols. 53rv, 60rv).

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: fine. Hand b: poor.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a, ʿAśratä Maryam: fols. 3ra-70rb (Text I). It seems possible that the text on fol. 6va-vb was written in a different hand. Hand b, Gäbrä Śǝllase: fols. 70va-72ra (Texts II, III; Additiones).

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; names of other characters like Mikaʾel (fols. 9ra, 20rb, 35rb); names of the protagonists in Texts II and III, names of the donor and of his relatives, name of the scribe in Text I; a few words like sälam "salutation" or its abbreviation (fols. 6ra-rb, 8va, 71ra, 71vb), ḥǝḍan "child" (fol. 28rb), Ṣǝyon "Zion" (fols. 10rb, 12va, 18ra etc.); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
Several groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1 and I-2, alternating with black lines; two lines alternating with black lines on the incipit page of Texts I-3 and I-4; two initial lines of sections of Text I-4; initial word or line of Texts II and III.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ሰ፡ for ሰላም፡ (fol. 6rb) ለ፡ ዓ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fol. 29rb) ለዓ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fol. 47vb, 67rb) ለዓለ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fols. 51rb, 54va) ለዓለመ፡ ዓ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fol. 19ra) ለዓለመ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fols. 45rb, 60ra, 64va)

otherdetails.otherdetail:
A paper print with a devotional image of the Virgin and Child (with legend in Italian) is sewn onto fol. 6r.
Text I-1 includes the hymn: - Sälam läki ḫoḫǝtä mǝśraq ... "Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…" (fol. 12ra-rb). Parts of Text I-1 are written in small script (fols. 5va-6va).
Text I-2 includes the hymns: - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam ʾǝmmu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali ... "O my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (fol. 8va-vb) (cp. ChRep no. 373) - Sälam läki ʾo-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn wä-ʾǝmmä bǝrhan ... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ..." (fols. 8vb-9rb).
The miracles of Mary (Text I-4) are numbered erroneously. The numbers are written in the margins. The text ends abruptly on fol. 70rb.
Text II is preceded by a rhymed supplication: አንስ[እ]፡ ኃይለከ፡ ወነ[ዓ፡] አድኅነነ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ርድአነ፡ በጸሎትከ፡ ተማፀኀነ፡ አርዌ፡ ጊጉይ፡ ኢደምአነ፡ ወኢምሥጠነ። ...

additional.cont: Fols. 1v-2ra: Täˀamrä ˀIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus": 1 miracle.
additional.det: The miracle is written probably, in hand b on unruled leaves. The initial line and nomina sacra are rubricated. Ḫaylä Maryam is mentioned in the supplication formula.

additional.cont: Fols. 71vb-72ra: Directives for weekly service (?).
additional.det: The text is written in Amharic and Gәʿәz, with many scribal errors, very crudely, right beneath Text III in hand b.

extras.extra: - Däqiqä Ṣǝyon "Children of Zion" are mentioned together with the name of the donor in some supplication formulas throughout Text I-4 (fol. 12va, 18ra, 20rb etc.). - Omitted words inserted interlineally: fols. 3ra, 3vb, 7ra, 15ra, 28ra, 41vb. - Corrections written over erasures: fols. 8ra-rb, 9va, 35va, 37va, 69vb. - Erasures marked with thin lines: fols. 5rb, 11ra, 35va, 62ra. - Cues for the rubricator: fols. 35rb, 50ra, 59va. - Small signs written throughout Text I, in the margins; their function is not clear. - Spaces for rubricated passages and names left unfilled: fol. 63va-vb. - Scribbles and crude drawings: fols. 54vb, 59vb, 71v, 72rv.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts and other occasions written in the upper margin between black and red lines, in the main hand: ዘቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል: fol. 35rb ዘልደት: fol. 64vb.

frames.frame: Fol. 70va (incipit page of Text II): crude ornamental band with crosses.
